title: Why Your Code Doesn't Work: It's Probably DNS
content: It's never not DNS. In this post, we explore the five stages of debugging grief, from denial ("It's can't be DNS") to acceptance ("It was DNS").
author: A Frustrated SysAdmin

title: The Art of Naming Variables: From `x` to `totalRevenueInUSDAfterTaxesAndFees`
content: Join us on a journey through the evolution of a developer's variable naming strategy, a tale of despair, clarity, and eventual carpal tunnel syndrome.
author: Captain Obvious

title: 10 Signs You Might Be a JavaScript Developer
content: If you've ever debated the merits of 5 different ways to write a for-loop or believe `[] + {}` is a valid form of artistic expression, this post is for you.
author: Framework Fanatic

title: The History of the <blink> Tag: A Tragic Tale of Web Design
content: A deep dive into the most beloved and hated HTML tag of all time. We explore its rise to infamy and its eventual, merciful demise. A must-read for digital historians and anyone who enjoys visual chaos.

title: CSS is Awesome: 10 Reasons Why (and 100 Reasons Why It's Not)
content: A balanced and totally unbiased look at the love-hate relationship every developer has with Cascading Style Sheets. We cover everything from `!important` abuse to the existential dread of centering elements.

title: I Automated My Job and Told No One: A 3-Year Experiment
content: An anonymous developer shares their story of writing a script that does their entire job, leaving them with 8 hours of free time a day. Learn what they did with their newfound freedom (spoiler: mostly video games).
That feeling when you fix one bug and two new ones appear.
The holy scriptures of programming: Stack Overflow.
"It's a simple feature, should only take an hour." - Famous last words.
